newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real drops 0.18 pct on arbitrage plays.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real drops 0.18 pct on arbitrage plays.

text.p: Brazil's real fell 0.18 percent to close at 1.0727 per dollar on arbitrage plays in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The real's fall in the spot commercial market was caused by a combination of dollar outflows and arbitrage between spot and future markets, dealers said.
At 1645 local/1945 GMT, preliminary figures for Friday's commercial and financial forex contracts showed a $27 million deficit. The two previous days accumulated a $116.8 million deficit.
In addition to dollar outflows, dealers speculated that the real currency was pressured by banks maintaining long positions in the spot market to arbitrage in the dollar futures market.
The banks are trying to push up the price of the dollar in the futures market by buying dollars in the spot market, they added.
The real has dropped 0.43 percent against the dollar since Tuesday.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real closed unchanged at 1.0732 per dollar in quiet trade, dealers said.
In the parallel market, the real rose 0.18 percent to end the day at 1.130 per dollar.
